location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Captain Charles Gray, Commanding at Derestan

mods.abstract: In this letter James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, acknowledges the receipt of Captain Charles Gray's letter, dated 10 October, which requested a supply of camaleins [camelines] for the force at Derestan. Dow states that as only a very small portion of the number of camaleins could be procured at Bushire, it became necessary to have them commissioned from Bussora [Basra].
